reporting-org.narrative: International Network for Bamboo and Rattan(INBAR)

title.narrative: MULTIPRODUCT SUPPLY-CHAINS FOR BAMBOO DEVELOPED TO MOVE SMES AND INDUSTRIES FROM LOW MARKET LEVEL PRODUCTION IN TO EFFICIENT AND INTEGRATED BAMBOO VALUE CHAIN

description.narrative: During the third quarter, the programme reached to mobilize 317 farmers to promote three primary cooperatives 2 in Ethiopia and one in Kenya. The capacity building and handholding support have been provided to the cooperative office bearers to manage and function the system. The Ethiopia trade and tourism enterprise (ETTE) has provided space at Hayat for establishing the multi-supply chains for linages with the bamboo furniture enterprises to establish a supply chain on the treated and quality bamboo raw materials for producing the bamboo furniture.

Target is to develop Six reliable supply chains developed with linkages to 30 primary and secondary association or cooperatives; 3000 (50 % women) beneficiaries.
During the year 1 of the programme, the focus was on creating awareness among bamboo growers, suppliers, SME and industries for adopting multiproduct supply-chains approach. The foundation work mainly organisation and formulation of primary associations for the development of reliable supply chain coupled with primary processing and commoditization was undertaken. A The programme has facilitated organizing six primary associations (Ethiopia 1, Kenya3, and Uganda2),to developed three reliable supply chains one each per beneficiary country. Moreover, this activity is clubbed with activity 3.3(market infrastructure development) for improving efficiency and flow of the supply chains. Overall, 686(378 M/ and 308 F) beneficiaries have been mobilised to promote primary association in three programme beneficiary countries.
